Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2007 05:14PM PamsPromise wrote: Wow Diane. That was excellent. I applaud you for your courage. Isn't it amazing what we go through and can still function? Now about the roller coaster ride. Someone please stop this thing because I want OFF!!! Thanks for summing up this entire experience better than I ever could. Take care and best wishes with your treatment.
Posts.Title: A Letter To My Doctors Bendcoles marie5890

Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2007 06:26PM PamsPromise wrote: Hi Denise: I'm so sorry you are having to worry about this at a time when you are looking foward to a trip with your family. I wish you all the best in your biopsy and that your results will be B9. I'm playing the waiting game myself with a biopsy planned for July 18. I alternate between being strong and then being a wreck....today I'm a wreck. My suggestion would be to share it with your family. This is way to stressful to handle alone. I will keep you in my prayers. Take care, Pam

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2007 05:16PM PamsPromise wrote: Thank you for all your kind words. To those of you that have received an abnormal mammo and to those of you waiting for results I wish you all the best and I am praying for B9 results. For my sisters going through treatment fighting this horrible disease I pray for your strength and recovery. All my best ---- Pam
Posts.Title: Received my biopsy news today. PamsPromise PamsPromise

Posts.Content: PamsPromise wrote: Hi everyone. I am very happy to say that my wire localization biopsy came back BENIGN today. No signs of any abnormality, just calcifications. Suggested repeat mammo in 6 months. Both my mother and grandmother had breast cancer. My mother is a 15 year survivor. I have worried about it for most of my life and since June 30 when I received my abnormal mammo and US results it has been just about the only thing on my mind. I don't know what I would have done without this site. The information on here is outstanding. My best to all of you going through this struggle. You are amazing women. Take care, Pam Dx 4/24/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
